results.title: Appropriate Harvesting
results.creator_credit: Mark Falzon, Michael Edols and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Under southern skies”.
The critical issue for the next century is how to sustain the productivity of agricultural land without contributing to any further environmental chaos. Sue Henckel investigates 3 different approaches to appropriate farming; a small flower company which harvests wildflowers, a vineyard in the Barossa Valley and a small tropical farm in far north Queensland.

results.title: Approaching poetry in English literature
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland, Television Production Unit, Box Hill College of TAFE and David Zweck
results.brief_description: Dr Ray Misson of Melbourne College of Advanced Education seeks to demystify poetry by providing a guide for students to help their approach to this area of literature. In a practical commonsense manner, he uses poems by Donne, Browning, Marvell and Coleridge as examples.

results.title: Approaches to therapy = Therapy choices
results.creator_credit: Carol Trussell and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
In this program, a patient is shown in consultation with representatives of the three main schools of psychotherapy. The psychodynamic school explores feelings and past history and recognises the existence of the conscious and the unconscious mind. The humanistic school believes in a continual process of growth and development which the therapist attempts to facilitate. The cognitive behaviourist identifies unsuccessful patterns of behaviour and attempts to replace them with new, successful ones. Although each of these approaches is different it is also most likely that any therapist may combine any or all of these techniques in their approach to therapy.

results.title: Approaches in early intervention
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disabilities Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
This video looks at the history of Early Intervention, how it provides information, support and resources to families along with individual development programs in order to promote their child’s development. The different types of services are looked at as well as showing the importance of assessment. This program is one of a series on Early Intervention.

results.title: Approach to sculpture
results.brief_description: The basis of sculptural expression, examples of different forms, and the work of Clement Meadmore. The use of lines, planes and shapes is demonstrated with models and exemplified in the work of modern and classic sculptors. The basic qualities of sculpture. Clement Meadmore working from a model to a full-scale finished sculpture in welded steel.

results.title: Approach to science
results.brief_description: Scientific methods during the war (World War II) were used both to save and destroy life. Science has made the modern world, as is illustrated by the development of electricity, it also maintains the world, for example, by purifying our water supplies. It is also expanding the modern world through such means as wireless waves and radar. This is a look at how science affects the lives of everyday people, and how having a better understanding of science can be helpful to society. No other credits available.

results.title: Approach to science
results.brief_description: This film, made as a tribute to both Sir Ian Clunies Ross and the study of science, illustrates the intangible attitude of the scientist, and shows the place of observation, creative reasoning, assumptions and experimental verification. It also shows the hard grind and disappointments. Suitable for mid-upper Secondary School students. No other credits available.

results.title: Approach to infant education
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Follows a day’s activities in a junior primary classroom and looks at how one teacher uses space and time in her teaching methods. The film also looks at the “vertical grouping” method of teaching.
